sub_title: Double Degree International Business & Management Graduate
summary:
🎓 Double Degree International Business & Management Graduate | 🤝 HR & Corporate Recruitment Professional | 🌏 Interpersonal & Intercultural Expert | Seeking New Challenges

Passionate about leadership, public speaking, human resource management and business development. A people person with a strong interest in communication and interpersonal relationships.

Embracing challenges to constantly improve and deliver high-quality work while stepping out of my comfort zone, following the quote that guides me: "A ship in the harbor is safe, but that's not what ships are built for." (John A. Shedd) 

Looking forward to connecting with like-minded professionals, sharing insights, and exploring potential collaborations! Feel free to connect with me here on LinkedIn!

education.field_of_study: B.Sc. International Management Double Degree Dutch-German (IMX)
B.BA. International Business Double Degree Dutch-German

awards.title: Winner - Fujifilm Future Challenge 2020
awards.description:
Fujifilm is the world's largest photographic and imaging company, as well as the leading innovators in the fields of bio-engineering, energy & environment, medicine and membranes. 

Partnering with universities from across the Netherlands, Germany, Belgium and Sweden, the company organises the Fujifilm Future Challenge, an entrepreneurial and business innovation-based student competition. During the 10-week programme, the teams of students work on new product ideas (based on Fujifilm core technologies), concentrating on the fields of "Energy and Environment" and "Healthcare and Life Science". 

Together with my team, I won the Fujifilm Future Challenge 2020 Award, as well as the Scale-up for Sustainability Originality Award, based on the development of the "Auxulus" contact lenses, a high-tech contact lens with several technologies integrated, protecting people with ASD and light sensitivity from external over-stimulation.

certifications.name: TestDaF (Test Deutsch als Fremdsprache) - C1 level

profile_positions.description: Wypoon Technologies specializes in sourcing the most experienced and professional IT specialists from all around the world, ensuring that your company has access to top-tier talent. Our international team makes sure to help you step-by-step to cross the borders of innovation and find your dream job in the Netherlands and Belgium!
profile_positions.title: 360 Degree IT Recruiter

profile_positions.description:
• Independent candidate management via Softgarden, including posting job advertisements, communicating with applicants, and organizing and participating in interviews and case studies
• Support of the HR consultants in day-to-day business (e.g. with the onboarding/offboarding processes) for Holtzbrinck Publishing Group and Neopubli GmbH
• Implementation of Corporate Health Management through the organization of regular in-house sport courses, workplace checks and preventive medical check-ups
• Conception, planning and organization of the Wellbeing Week 2022 in the Stuttgart office, as well as the online programme for subsidiaries Germany-wide
• Participation in the implementation of the Holtzbrinck Diversity Strategy, supervision and design of the Holtzbrinck Diversity Website
• Active Sourcing via LinkedIn and Xing for vacancies at Holtzbrinck Publishing Group, Holtzbrinck Digital GmbH and Neopubli GmbH
• Research on labour and social security law issues
profile_positions.title: Human Resources

profile_positions.description:
EuroDev, established in 1996 with offices in the Netherlands and France, provides a successful business development model for North American companies that want to expand their business in Europe.

As a business development intern, I was, together with a team of inside sales specialists and business managers, responsible for pioneering the marketing and sales activities of our North American customers.

These activities included conducting market research, competitor analysis, writing short and long-term strategies, identifying market potential, engaging the target audience, setting up appointments with potential customers, organizing business trips, managing the sales pipelines, deal closing, and managing existing accounts.

Partnerships:
- Fellowes (https://www.fellowes.com/us/en)
- Airex Manufacturing (http://www.airexmfg.com/)
- Unified Analytics (https://unifiedanalytics.no/)
- Amity (https://www.amity.co/) 
- MasterFluid Solutions (https://www.masterfluidsolutions.com/)
profile_positions.title: International Sales Outsourcing

profile_positions.description:
As part of the Avans School of International Studies' promo team, I take part in events that enhance the academy's visibility on both national and international scales. 

The events include but are not limited to Open Days, Orientation Days, Experience Days, Webinars, International Universities Fairs. 

The end-goal is to attract potential students by providing them with all the information needed in order to find a suitable study programme.
profile_positions.title: Promo Student

profile_positions.description:
Having a part-time job next to my Bachelor studies taught me discipline, time management and a better self-organization sense. 
Moreover, working in the hospitality industry contributed greatly to the improvement of my customer service skills, my attention to details, my ability to work well as part of a team, and my ability to work quickly and calmly in a high-pressure environment.
profile_positions.title: Crew Member

volunteer_experiences.description:
As the local coordinator of the most unconventional Romanian NGO, I was in charge of a team comprised of over 60 volunteers. Together, we organized charity events in order to both benefit our community and raise funds for various social causes that needed our help.
My responsibilities included but were not limited to: organizing volunteer recruitment sessions and team building days, writing projects, being in constant touch with the local authorities, contacting potential fundraisers, communicating with the other local associations and NGOs in order to establish partnerships, managing Beard Brothers Craiova's accounts on different social media platforms and constantly working towards increasing its visibility, and, last but not least, ensuring that all volunteers were safe and content and that their well-being always came first in all of the conducted activities. 
Some of the activities that our team helped organize/ was part of: charitable parties, talent shows, quiz nights and board game nights, visits to the local retirement home, Catch a Smile Day (a campaign that was initially started by Beard Brothers in Cluj, Romania, and that is now taking place on an international scale every year), and, in the light of the current events, fundraising campaigns for the acquisition of much-needed equipment for the medical staff dealing with COVID-19 in my hometown, Craiova, Romania. 
Becoming a local coordinator of an NGO helped me discover a new face of the volunteering world. It helped me improve my patience, taught me how to handle conflicts, made me more organized, highly improved my communication, public speaking and leadership skills and, last but not least, it tremendously impacted the way I currently perceive the world.

As a volunteer, I visited one of my hometown's local orphanages weekly, for a couple of hours, and I was responsible for organizing educational and recreational activities for the children residing there. Moreover, I helped organize team buildings for the new volunteers joining the organization, as well as supported with the recruitment process.

The European Youth Parliament is one of the largest European platforms for political debate and intercultural cooperation, enabling young people with the opportunity of freely expressing their ideas on current European developments, in a well-structured and enjoyable way. 
As a member of the EYP, I participated in 5 events in different European countries (Romania, Slovenia and Germany). While being a delegate, I participated in the regional session, subsequently being selected to represent my city at the national session. The experience helped me improve my research and debate skills.
Following this experience, I joined a regional session in Germany (Trier 2018) as part of the media team, thus highly developing my creativity and my photography skills. Lastly, I helped organize two sessions in Slovenia - a regional (Maribor 2018) and a national one. Ljubljana 2018 - 4th National Selection Conference gathered approximately 200 people from all over Europe in a unique 5-day event, consisting of an Opening Ceremony, Team Building activities, Committee Work, Cultural Evenings, a two-day long General Assembly and a festive Gala, followed by the Closing Ceremony. As a Delegates' Support Organizer, I was in charge of the well-being of all the delegates, from carefully supervising their application process, to committee allocation and to a non-stop support for delegates prior to, during and after the 5-day event.  
Being a member of the European Youth Parliament tremendously improved my critical thinking, public speaking, communication, teamwork and organizational skills, while simultaneously making me aware of the current issues that the European Union and its partners have to deal with on a day-to-day basis, thus helping me become an involved and dedicated European citizen.

During this workcamp, I spent three weeks in Enkenbach-Alsenborn, Germany, alongside other 14 volunteers coming from all over the world. We worked together with the local authorities in order to renovate the town's biggest park, which was highly deteriorated due to natural causes. The experience improved my practical skills and it profoundly enhanced my intercultural communication skills.

During this programme, I visited children affected by various diseases (ranging from mild to advanced), who were being treated in my hometown's biggest hospital. For a couple of hours per week, I made sure they felt loved and integrated, by organizing various situation-adapted leisure activities for them. The experience tremendously improved my empathy and had a big impact on the way I now perceive life and its fragility. Moreover, it was the beginning of the long volunteering journey I have since embarked upon.

In 2018, the ”Planet Shakespeare” edition united performances from every continent. As a volunteer, I was responsible for supporting the performers and their acts. Moreover, I was responsible for promoting the event in our community by various means (social media, flyers) and for contributing to the festival's visibility. I worked alongside the employees of the local theatre and, together with them and with the volunteer crew, we made sure that the festival was an acclaimed success and a pleasant artistic experience for everybody involved.

Let's Do It Foundation aims to engage people in various volunteering activities, having the end goal of achieving a clean and healthy planet. During this specific project in 2018, I was part of the local team that helped organize the biggest ever civic action against waste – World Cleanup Day 2018 - in my hometown, Craiova, Romania. 

Prior to the event, I was responsible for identifying the areas that needed a thorough waste cleanup, for mapping them, for contacting schools and finding volunteers, and, ultimately, for making sure that, on the day of the event, everybody worked efficiently and effectively while simultaneously enjoying themselves.

During a two-week programme, I volunteered (alongside other national and international volunteers) at The Educational Daily Centre “Pinocchio”, in Panciu, Romania. The centre's main purpose is to work on social integration of the local minorities, starting from an early age, creating a safe space for kids coming from socially disadvantaged backgrounds to develop themselves. I was responsible for entertaining the kids visiting the centre every day, by organizing various activities for them, such as treasure hunts, cooking experiences, sports competitions, face painting, educational activities etc. This experience tremendously improved my communication skills and empathy, while simultaneously developing my intercultural sensitivity.
